author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Banging my head against some gas mismatches

author: racytech
content: <@892053833121923094>  can we expect EOF tests on top of Prague? I am not able to run `blockchain_tests` for now, since our eof branch is always merged with main, which contains updates for Prague proposals. So it's a bit problematic to undo some updates without braking stuff.

author: _shemnon
content: EXT\*CALL has different return values for success and failure.  PC=28 gets a 1 from the EXTCALL, should be a 0 as it was EXT\*CALL success.  So SSTORE price goes up as it's 0->1 storage rather than 0->0.

author: _shemnon
content: If you fill from Besu the blockchain tests have Prague and Cancun system transactions executed.

author: _shemnon
content: Best to fill from a `main` branch dev build to get all the bug fixes.

author: marioevz
content: What config do we need in besu to run Prague+EOF? I could try to add it today to the eest ci to build with this instead

author: _shemnon
content: For compatibility with the fill tests, the "Prague" fork in t8n and reference tests maps internally to the "PragueEOF" fork.  You can also use the "CancunEOF" fork in t8n to get the cancun+EOF.  Besu refernece tests don't have a Prague / no EOF mode.  What other info do you need for config?

author: marioevz
content: We would be building the t8n server in the ci, so the minimal build steps would be very nice
